title: The Story That Hurts

dialogue.speaker: Architect
dialogue.text: *striking through the machine diagram with chalk* We could map every neuron, trace every synapse, catalog every chemical... and still miss the point entirely.

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: *sitting alone in the empty classroom* I thought if I understood the mechanism, the pain would make sense. Like fixing a broken engine.

dialogue.speaker: Architect
dialogue.text: *turning from board with compassion* But you're not here for the parts list. You're here for the story of the machine.

dialogue.speaker: Architect
dialogue.text: *voice softening* And more than that—you're here to ask why the story hurts sometimes.

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: *tears threatening* Why does consciousness come with suffering? Why does awareness include the ability to hurt?

dialogue.speaker: Architect
dialogue.text: *sitting on desk edge, professor becoming friend* Maybe because a story without the possibility of pain would be no story at all. The hurt isn't a bug in consciousness—it's proof that the story matters.

scene_context: In an empty college classroom, the Architect as professor helps Evan understand that consciousness isn't a machine to be fixed but a story to be lived, complete with its inherent capacity for suffering.

visual_progression.panel_1: The Architect striking through mechanical diagrams, rejecting reductionist explanations
visual_progression.panel_2: Close-up of compassionate recognition as professor becomes confidant
